required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Oxygen Adminstration by Nasal Cannula and High Flow Cannula During Bronchoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Oxygen Administration During Bronchoscopy in Children, High Flow and Common Nasal Cannula: a Randomized Controled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized controled trial to compare oxygen desaturation during fiberoptic bronchoscopy using oxygen administered with nasal prongs and high flow nasal cannula. Drops in oxygen saturation are frequent during bronchoscopy and limit the procedure compromising patient security. The investigator's aim is to contribute to select better way of oxygen administration which could prevent desaturations during bronchoscopy in children.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Trough study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with Oxygen saturation under 94% during bronchoscopy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Trough study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with Oxygen saturation < 94% and > 90 %

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Trough study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with Oxygen saturation< 90%

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Trough study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with Breath rate more than p95 fore age for more than 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Trough study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with Breath rate 0 for more than 20 seconds or recure intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Trough study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with Heart rate less than p5 forte age for more than 20 seconds

arm_group.description: Oxygen administration up to 4 liters according defined protocol
Oxygen administered with high flow nasal cannula according child weight and protocol designed for this study

intervention.intervention_name: Oxygen administration with Common nasal cannula
intervention.description: Oxygen administration during elective flexible bronchoscopy in children with high flow nasal cannula with inspired oxygen fraction 1.

intervention.intervention_name: Oxygen administration with high flow nasal cannula, device Airvo2 Fisher and Pykel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- elective flexible bronchoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- admitted in Neonatal intensive care
- previous respiratory support: oxygen any device, non invasive or invasive ventilation
- patient who may benefit with continuous positive pressure during procedure

overall_official.last_name: Francisco de Borja Osona Rodriguez, PhD
